page.title: 07THE VILLAGE OF LIFF
page.content: This village has changed dramatically over the past 20 years. Instead of the old farmsteads which used to occupy the area there are now modern houses which are occupied by commuters who travel to Dundee. The School,which was built in 1860,lies about half a mile from the main housing area. The most dominant building in the area however is the Hospital which used to be named Westgreen. This Hospital caters for the mentally infirm and people who have suffered from nervous complaints. In the village itself there is a most impresive Church,which was built in 1839.There is an equally impressive Manse which requires some structural attention.
